uk.ac.ucl.cs.nterreri.chessboard

Class chessboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ucl.cs.nterreri.chessboard.chessboard

  • public class chessboard
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple chess-game simulation program.

    The program writes a representation of the chess game to the console and reads user input from console. Only simple chess moves are allowed (that means, no castling and pawns do not become queens).

    TODO: add turns and endgame conditions after which the board is displayed one more time before the program terminates.

    Version:
    04/11/15 - 3
    Author:
    salpo

      • printBoard

        public static void printBoard(chessboard.Chessmen[][] chessboard)
        Prints chessboard to the console

        y for rows, x for columns, standing for different positions on different axes: +------------> x axis | | | | v y axis

        Parameters:
        chessboard - a two-dimensional array representing the chessboard

      • initialize_chessboard

        Parameters:

      • move

        public static void move(chessboard.Chessmen[][] chessboard,
                        java.lang.String move)
        Parses parameter move and executes the command, changing chessboard.

        First checks if move can be parsed to indicating two valid positions on the board, then calls isMoveLegal. If this returns true, then the piece at the first position is moved to the second, overwriting the Chessmen in that position.

        Also checks if the player is attempting to move a white piece on a black turn (and viceversa).

        Finally, if the move is legitimate, it executes it, then increases the turn counter.

        Parameters:
        chessboard - a two-dimensional array representing the chessboard
        move - a string expressing a move, formatted as, e.g., a1 to a5 or a1 to c3

      • isMoveLegal

        public static boolean isMoveLegal(chessboard.Chessmen[][] chessboard,
                                  int ix,
                                  int iy,
                                  int fx,
                                  int fy)
        Returns true if the move specified in terms of initial coordinates (ix, iy) and final coordinates (ix, iy) is legal, given the piece occupying the first set of coordinates. False otherwise.

        For most types of pieces, calls either isWhite or isBlack to check if the final position is already occupied by a piece of the same colour as the one to be moved, then calls isPatternLegal and isPathFree to decide whether the move is legal.

        The only pieces that receive special treatment are the pawns because of the complexity of the rules governing their movement. Their rules are handled within the present method, and not delegated to isPatternLegal and isPathFree.

        Parameters:
        chessboard -
        ix -
        iy -
        fx -
        fy -
        Returns:
        true if move is legal, false otherwise

      • diagonalIsFree

        public static boolean diagonalIsFree(chessboard.Chessmen[][] chessboard,
                                     int ix,
                                     int iy,
                                     int fx,
                                     int fy)
        Parameters:
        chessboard -
        ix -
        iy -
        fx -
        fy -
        Returns:

      • pathIsFree

        public static boolean pathIsFree(chessboard.Chessmen[][] chessboard,
                                 int ix,
                                 int iy,
                                 int fx,
                                 int fy)
        First, identifies the pattern described (if this is any of the legal patterns for chess). Then, decides whether the path described by the coordinates is free of interposing pieces.

        Parameters:
        chessboard -
        ix -
        iy -
        fx -
        fy -
        Returns:
        true if the path described by the coordinates is free of pieces between the initial and final position, false otherwise.

      • find_xcoord

        public static int find_xcoord(java.lang.String position_on_chessboard)
        Parameters:
        position_on_chessboard - string describing a position on the chessboard by a letter and number (example: e6)
        Returns:
        Returns the number corrisponding to the array index of the x coordinate of the position indicated, or -1 if no valid position has been parsed from the parameter.
        See Also:
        move(Chessmen[][], String), find_ycoord(String)

      • find_ycoord

        Returns:

      • isWhiteTurn

        public static boolean isWhiteTurn()
        Returns:

      • endgame

        public static int endgame(chessboard.Chessmen[][] chessboard)
        Called at the end of each turn.
        Parameters:
        chessboard -
        Returns:
        0 if both the black and white kings are still somewhere on the board.

        -1 if the white king is not on the board

        -2 if the black king is not on the board
